content: Is there equivalent of D7's page--node--blog.tpl.php for Backdrop? Template suggestions are not showing any content-type specific templates. Using the template_preprocess_page(&$variables) to create one also doesn't work because there is no $node in variables. How do you, guys, override page components depending on content type?

@Alan Mels Are you sure you want a separate page.tpl.php template for blog nodes? Because page.tpl.php affects the entire page (html tag, stylesheets, javascript files, body tag, all regions, etc.)...
Do you mean node.tpl.php instead? image.png
What Im' trying to do is to override a note title of specific content type without touching the database
Couldn't find the node type in node.tpl.php, page-components.tpl.php and page-components.tpl.php
The $title is there and I can override it, however the change goes to all node types, unfortunately. That's why I was looking to narrow the template file to a node type
See red highlighted section of screenshot above
Use node--[content_type].tpl.php
Lemme look again
Unfortunately you can not override $title that you see on a node page with node--[content_type].tpl.php
Oh ok, you want to override the page title, but for specific content types...
And page.tpl.php is so much different than on D7, it doesn't have $title anymore
@Alan Mels Are you wanting to change the page title, or the node title?
The title that you see when you are on a node page.

There are template suggestions like block--system:page-components:title-combo.tpl.php or page-components--title-combo.tpl.php, but none of 'em have node type to check. I could take page argument as nid and load the whole node, but to node_load() ing just to check node type seems overkill

@Alan Mels I wouldn't do this in a template file, I'd do it in a preprocess function... Try this:

function [MY_THEME]_preprocess_node(&$variables) {
  if ($variables['type'] == 'post') {
    $title = backdrop_get_title() . t(' - Post');
    backdrop_set_title($title);
  }
}
Belissimo! Works like charm. Thank you!
Or change it in the layout directly, if I'm understanding. You can place the title like a regular field.
Ah nevermind.

Alan Mels said:

Is there equivalent of D7's page--node--blog.tpl.php for Backdrop? Template suggestions are not showing any content-type specific templates

FWIW, I dont think these page level suggestions were automatic in D7 either. I think you had to create a preprocess function to make content-type-template suggestions available at the page.tpl level. Like:

function mytheme_process_page(&$variables) {
  $variables['theme_hook_suggestions'][] = 'page__node__'. $variables['node']->type;
}
@Rob Feature, right. But even if you create such a template, the variables available are different than on D7. You can't get to $title there.

I'm assuming $title now resides in a Layout, then? I know this goes beyond your original question, but it seems like this would be a good place to have a layout with no title, then you could implement that anywhere you wanted thru the Layouts UI. That would be my first instinct, at least.
My comment from earlier relates to the UI -- in core layouts already allow you to override the title/place it as a block on a particular layout.
So if you have a layout for a particular content type, you can have the title placed in a custom location for that content type pretty easily through the UI.
But does the title block support tokens in the Layout UI. I doubt it does.
